clusters.title: Ghislaine Maxwell tells US Justice Department Epstein didn't keep 'client list'
clusters.neutral_headline: Ghislaine Maxwell's Interview Transcripts Released by Justice Department

items.title: Ghislaine Maxwell tells US Justice Department Epstein didn't keep 'client list'
items.standfirst: The US Justice Department on Friday released a transcript of an interview with Ghislaine Maxwell conducted by US President Donald Trump's former personal lawyer and Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche. Maxwell, who is serving a 20-year-prison sentence for recruiting underage girls for disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein, has since been moved to a minimum security prison in Texas.
items.content: The US Justice Department on Friday released a transcript of an interview with Ghislaine Maxwell conducted by US President Donald Trump's former personal lawyer and Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche. Maxwell, who is serving a 20-year-prison sentence for recruiting underage girls for disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein, has since been moved to a minimum security prison in Texas.

items.title: Epstein records sent to House Oversight Committee
items.standfirst: The Department of Justice sent the first wave of Jeffrey Epstein case files to Congress on Friday. Plus, the DOJ released full transcripts and audios of Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche's two-day interview with Epstein associate Ghislaine Maxwell. Blanche met with Maxwell last month amid backlash over the Trump administration's handling of the Epstein case. CBS News congressional correspondent Nikole Killion reports.
items.content: The Department of Justice sent the first wave of Jeffrey Epstein case files to Congress on Friday. Plus, the DOJ released full transcripts and audios of Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche's two-day interview with Epstein associate Ghislaine Maxwell. Blanche met with Maxwell last month amid backlash over the Trump administration's handling of the Epstein case. CBS News congressional correspondent Nikole Killion reports.

items.title: Ghislaine Maxwell praises Trump in transcripts released by government

items.content: Partner of Jeffrey Epstein insists Trump never engaged in inappropriate behavior amid scrutiny over past relationship.

items.title: Justice Department releases transcripts from its conversations with Ghislaine Maxwell
items.standfirst: Maxwell spoke with top DOJ officials over the course of two days in late July. Asked about President Trump, she said she had never witnessed him "in any inappropriate setting in any way."
items.content: Maxwell spoke with top DOJ officials over the course of two days in late July. Asked about President Trump, she said she had never witnessed him "in any inappropriate setting in any way."(Image credit: John Minchillo)

ai_summary: Ghislaine Maxwell stated she never saw President Trump in any inappropriate setting.
The Justice Department released transcripts of interviews with Maxwell.
Maxwell is serving a 20-year sentence for Epstein-related crimes.
The interviews were conducted by Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche.
Maxwell was moved to a minimum security prison in Texas.

items.title: Foreign nationals among 5 killed in New York state tour bus crash
items.standfirst: Passengers from China, India, Philippines, the Middle East and US were on board the bus when it crashed at full speed.
items.content: Passengers from China, India, Philippines, the Middle East and US were on board the bus when it crashed at full speed.

items.title: Five dead after tour bus crashes on New York highway
items.standfirst: Police say most of the victims are tourists from India, China and the Philippines.
items.content: Police say most of the victims are tourists from India, China and the Philippines.

items.title: 5 people dead after tour bus rolls over in New York, police say
items.standfirst: A tour bus with more than 50 passengers lost control and rolled over on the New York State Thruway near Pembroke, killing five people, police said.
items.content: A tour bus with more than 50 passengers lost control and rolled over on the New York State Thruway near Pembroke, killing five people, police said.

items.title: Everything we know about the deadly tour bus crash in western New York
items.standfirst: Multiple people are dead after a tour bus with more than 50 passengers lost control and rolled over on a major highway in western New York, according to police. WIVB reporter Patrick Ryan reports from the scene.
items.content: Multiple people are dead after a tour bus with more than 50 passengers lost control and rolled over on a major highway in western New York, according to police. WIVB reporter Patrick Ryan reports from the scene.

items.title: Tour bus rollover kills 5 on interstate highway in western New York
items.standfirst: A tour bus returning to New York City from Niagara Falls with 54 people on board crashed and rolled on a highway near Pembroke, killing five passengers and injuring many others, authorities said.
items.content: A tour bus returning to New York City from Niagara Falls with 54 people on board crashed and rolled on a highway near Pembroke, killing five passengers and injuring many others, authorities said.(Image credit: Libby March/Buffalo News)

items.title: New York tour bus crash on interstate leaves multiple people dead and injured, police say
items.standfirst: The bus apparently lost control on Interstate 90 near Pembroke, about 25 miles east of Buffalo. People inside were ejected as the windows shattered.
items.content: The bus apparently lost control on Interstate 90 near Pembroke, about 25 miles east of Buffalo. People inside were ejected as the windows shattered.

ai_summary: A tour bus rolled over on a New York highway near Pembroke.
Five people died in the tour bus crash.
The bus had over 50 passengers on board.
Victims included tourists from China, India, and the Philippines.
The bus lost control on Interstate 90.

clusters.title: Key takeaways from the parole hearings of Erik and Lyle Menendez
clusters.neutral_headline: Menendez Brothers Denied Parole in California

items.title: Key takeaways from the parole hearings of Erik and Lyle Menendez
items.standfirst: California brothers convicted of their parents’ murders in 1989 were both denied parole this week – here’s what we knowThis week’s parole hearings were the latest twist in the saga of Lyle and Erik Menendez, who have been behind bars since their arrest in 1990 for killing their parents with shotguns.At their televised trial, which was a 1990s media sensation, the brothers said the killings were an act of self-defense after years of sexual abuse by their father. Continue reading...
items.content: California brothers convicted of their parents’ murders in 1989 were both denied parole this week – here’s what we knowThis week’s parole hearings were the latest twist in the saga of Lyle and Erik Menendez, who have been behind bars since their arrest in 1990 for killing their parents with shotguns.At their televised trial, which was a 1990s media sensation, the brothers said the killings were an act of self-defense after years of sexual abuse by their father. Continue reading...

items.title: Lyle and Erik Menendez denied parole by California board
items.standfirst: California prison officials have denied parole for Erik and Lyle Menendez.
items.content: California prison officials have denied parole for Erik and Lyle Menendez.

items.title: Lyle Menendez joins brother in being denied parole in parents' LA murder
items.standfirst: The hearing stretched for more than 10 hours and examined his violations in prison and the 1989 killings of his parents in their Beverly Hills mansion.
items.content: The hearing stretched for more than 10 hours and examined his violations in prison and the 1989 killings of his parents in their Beverly Hills mansion.

items.title: Erik and Lyle Menendez both denied parole in California
items.standfirst: Erik and Lyle Menendez have both been denied parole in California, quashing their hopes they will be released from prison any time soon.
items.content: Erik and Lyle Menendez have both been denied parole in California, quashing their hopes they will be released from prison any time soon.

items.title: Lyle Menendez denied parole a day after brother Erik’s bid rejected
items.standfirst: Parole board rules against elder Menendez brother, convicted over killing parents in Los Angeles in 1989Lyle Menendez was denied parole for his role in the 1989 killings of his parents on Friday, just a day after the California parole board denied the release of his brother Erik.California governor Gavin Newsom will have the final say in whether or not the 57-year-old will be released. Continue reading...
items.content: Parole board rules against elder Menendez brother, convicted over killing parents in Los Angeles in 1989Lyle Menendez was denied parole for his role in the 1989 killings of his parents on Friday, just a day after the California parole board denied the release of his brother Erik.California governor Gavin Newsom will have the final say in whether or not the 57-year-old will be released. Continue reading...

items.title: Lyle Menendez denied parole a day after brother Erik also rejected
items.standfirst: Lyle Menendez, the older of the notorious brothers who were jailed for murdering their parents in Los Angeles in 1989, has been denied parole.
items.content: Lyle Menendez, the older of the notorious brothers who were jailed for murdering their parents in Los Angeles in 1989, has been denied parole.

items.title: Lyle Menendez argues for parole, a day after his brother was denied
items.standfirst: A day after a California board denied Erik Menendez parole, his older brother Lyle made his case for release. The brothers have spent more than 30 years in prison after they were convicted of the murders of their parents. NBC News’ Liz Kreutz reports.
items.content: A day after a California board denied Erik Menendez parole, his older brother Lyle made his case for release. The brothers have spent more than 30 years in prison after they were convicted of the murders of their parents. NBC News’ Liz Kreutz reports.

items.title: 8/22: CBS Mornings Plus
items.standfirst: Erik Menendez denied parole in California hearing. Also, Jeep CEO Bob Broderdorf unveils hybrid Cherokee.
items.content: Erik Menendez denied parole in California hearing. Also, Jeep CEO Bob Broderdorf unveils hybrid Cherokee.

ai_summary: Erik and Lyle Menendez were both denied parole by the California parole board.
The brothers were convicted of murdering their parents in 1989.
Lyle Menendez was denied parole a day after his brother Erik.
The parole hearings examined violations and the 1989 killings.
California's governor will make the final decision on Lyle's release.

The deal gives the government a significant equity position in Intel.

items.standfirst: John Bolton served as national security adviser during US President Donald Trump’s first term before quitting and facing scrutiny over a book he wrote about his time in government. The FBI raided his Maryland home Friday as part of a probe into the handling of classified records.

Trump stated he had no knowledge of the search.

clusters.title: Carney says Canada will match U.S. tariff exemptions under USMCA trade pact
clusters.neutral_headline: Canada to Match U.S. Tariff Exemptions Under USMCA

items.title: Carney says Canada will match U.S. tariff exemptions under USMCA trade pact
items.standfirst: Canada is dropping many of its retaliatory tariffs to match U.S. tariff exemptions for goods covered under the United States-Mexico-Canada trade pact, Prime Minister Mark Carney announced Friday.
items.content: Canada is dropping many of its retaliatory tariffs to match U.S. tariff exemptions for goods covered under the United States-Mexico-Canada trade pact, Prime Minister Mark Carney announced Friday.

items.title: Canada to remove retaliatory tariffs on many U.S. goods
items.standfirst: Prime Minister Mark Carney said Canada is dropping 25% tariffs on a long list of U.S. products to ease trade tensions.
items.content: Prime Minister Mark Carney said Canada is dropping 25% tariffs on a long list of U.S. products to ease trade tensions.

items.title: Canada to ease most retaliatory tariffs against United States
items.standfirst: Prime Minister Mark Carney says most Canadian goods will be exempted from US tariffs while some sectoral duties remain.
items.content: Prime Minister Mark Carney says most Canadian goods will be exempted from US tariffs while some sectoral duties remain.

items.title: Trump says 'We want to be very good to Canada,' as its leader drops some tariffs
items.standfirst: After Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney announced he would lower tariffs, President Trump said "We want to be very good to Canada. I like Carney a lot. I think he's a very good person."
items.content: After Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney announced he would lower tariffs, President Trump said "We want to be very good to Canada. I like Carney a lot. I think he's a very good person."(Image credit: Spencer Colby)

items.title: Canada to drop counter-tariffs on some US goods one day after call with Trump
items.standfirst: Mark Carney says change will go into effect on 1 September but tariffs on steel, aluminum and autos will remainCanada will drop its counter-tariffs on some American goods in the coming days, Mark Carney has said, as the country’s prime minister looks to end a protracted trade war with longtime ally the United States.From 1 September, the Canadian government will remove some levies on US goods that comply with the North American free-trade pact, a move meant to “match” how the White House treated Canadian goods. Levies on steel, aluminum and autos will remain in place. Continue reading...
items.content: Mark Carney says change will go into effect on 1 September but tariffs on steel, aluminum and autos will remainCanada will drop its counter-tariffs on some American goods in the coming days, Mark Carney has said, as the country’s prime minister looks to end a protracted trade war with longtime ally the United States.From 1 September, the Canadian government will remove some levies on US goods that comply with the North American free-trade pact, a move meant to “match” how the White House treated Canadian goods. Levies on steel, aluminum and autos will remain in place. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Canada will remove retaliatory tariffs on many U.S. goods.
The move aligns with U.S. tariff exemptions under the USMCA trade pact.
The changes will take effect on September 1st.
Tariffs on steel, aluminum, and autos will remain.
The decision aims to ease trade tensions with the United States.

clusters.title: Trump 'Not Happy' US Factory Hit by Russian Strike in Ukraine
clusters.neutral_headline: Russia Rejects Zelensky Talks, Trump Says Setting Up Summit Difficult

items.title: Trump 'Not Happy' US Factory Hit by Russian Strike in Ukraine
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump insinuated in a social media post that he’s open to Ukraine launching more attacks on Russia, as the White House looks to pressure Russian President Vladimir Putin to agree to a one-on-one meeting with Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelenskiy. #politics #russia #trump…
items.content: President Donald Trump insinuated in a social media post that he’s open to Ukraine launching more attacks on Russia, as the White House looks to pressure Russian President Vladimir Putin to agree to a one-on-one meeting with Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelenskiy. #politics #russia #trump…

items.title: Former ambassador to Ukraine says there is more progress on Ukraine than it might seem
items.standfirst: Prospects for a summit between Russian President Vladimir Putin and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, always dim, appear nearly non-existent. Russian foreign minister Sergei Lavrov told NBC News that a summit agenda is "not ready at all." Former U.S. ambassador to Ukraine William Taylor joins "The Takeout" to discuss.
items.content: Prospects for a summit between Russian President Vladimir Putin and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, always dim, appear nearly non-existent. Russian foreign minister Sergei Lavrov told NBC News that a summit agenda is "not ready at all." Former U.S. ambassador to Ukraine William Taylor joins "The Takeout" to discuss.

items.title: Russia rejects Zelensky talks, Trump says setting up summit like mixing ‘oil and vinegar’
items.standfirst: Russia on Friday ruled out an immediate meeting between President Vladimir Putin and Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelensky, despite a claim by US President Donald Trump earlier this week that he was arranging a summit. Trump on Friday said setting up a Zelensky-Putin summit was as hard as mixing "oil and vinegar".
items.content: Russia on Friday ruled out an immediate meeting between President Vladimir Putin and Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelensky, despite a claim by US President Donald Trump earlier this week that he was arranging a summit. Trump on Friday said setting up a Zelensky-Putin summit was as hard as mixing "oil and vinegar".

items.title: Russia's foreign minister says no Putin-Zelenskyy summit planned despite Trump's peace push
items.standfirst: Russia’s top diplomat said Friday that no meeting is planned between President Vladimir Putin and Ukraine’s Volodymyr Zelenskyy, casting new doubt on President Donald Trump’s push for a summit to end the war.“Putin is ready to meet with Zelenskyy when the agenda is ready for a summit, and this agenda is not ready at all,” Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov told NBC News’ “Meet the Press” moderator Kristen Welker in an exclusive interview
items.content: Russia’s top diplomat said Friday that no meeting is planned between President Vladimir Putin and Ukraine’s Volodymyr Zelenskyy, casting new doubt on President Donald Trump’s push for a summit to end the war.“Putin is ready to meet with Zelenskyy when the agenda is ready for a summit, and this agenda is not ready at all,” Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov told NBC News’ “Meet the Press” moderator Kristen Welker in an exclusive interview

ai_summary: Russia ruled out an immediate meeting between Putin and Zelenskyy.
Trump said setting up a Zelensky-Putin summit is difficult.
Russia's foreign minister stated no summit agenda is ready.
Trump had previously claimed he was arranging a summit.
The White House seeks a meeting between Putin and Zelenskyy.

Republican State Governor Greg Abbott is expected to quickly sign it into law.
items.content: Texas lawmakers approved a new electoral map early Saturday that would likely give the Republicans five new seats in next year's midterm elections in a move explicitly designed to preserve US President Donald Trump's grip on Congress. items.title: Texas senate gives final approval to redrawn congressional map that heavily favours Republicans
items.standfirst: The map will now be sent to governor Greg Abbott, a Republican, who is expected to quickly sign it into lawThe Texas senate has given final approval to a redrawn congressional map that gives Republicans a chance to pick up as many as five congressional seats, fulfilling a brazen political request from Donald Trump to shore up the GOP’s standing before next year’s midterm elections.It will now be sent to governor Greg Abbott, a Republican, who is expected to quickly sign it into law, however Democrats have vowed to challenge it in court. The Texas house of representatives approved the map on Wednesday on an 88-52 party-line vote, before the senate approved it early on Saturday. Continue reading...
items.content: The map will now be sent to governor Greg Abbott, a Republican, who is expected to quickly sign it into lawThe Texas senate has given final approval to a redrawn congressional map that gives Republicans a chance to pick up as many as five congressional seats, fulfilling a brazen political request from Donald Trump to shore up the GOP’s standing before next year’s midterm elections.It will now be sent to governor Greg Abbott, a Republican, who is expected to quickly sign it into law, however Democrats have vowed to challenge it in court.
